etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish زوراكی (zorāki), from Greek ζοράκι (zoráki), from Persian زور (zôr, “force”) + Greek -άκι (-áki, diminutive suffix). Alternatively, borrowed from Persian زورکی (zôraki, “forcibly”), from زور (zôr, “force”) + ـک (-ak, diminutive suffix) + ـی (-i, adjectival suffix). Compare Azerbaijani zorakı.
